message.content:
We make the right-hand-side look more like the left-hand-side by expanding the products on the left:  \[(5x^2 - 6x + 7)(4x^2 +tx + 10) = 20x^4 + (20t - 24)x^3 + (50t + 40 - 42)x^2 + (7t - 60)x + 70.\]We know each coefficient of the polynomial on the left-hand side of the equation must equal the corresponding coefficient of $20x^4 -54x^3 +114x^2 -102x +70$ on the right-hand side, so we have the equations \begin{align*}
20t - 24 &= -54, \\
50t - 2 &= 114, \\
7t - 60 &= -102, \\
70 &= 70.
\end{align*}Solving this system, we find $t = \boxed{8}.$
